description.narrative: Money Trail is a joint project initiated by Free Press Unlimited, Journalismfund.eu, Finance Uncovered and Oxfam Novib in April 2018. Journalismfund.eu provides grants to financial investigative journalism projects. Our mission is to end illicit financial flows to ensure more equitable and inclusive societies that boosts citizens# access to health, education and economic opportunity. Developing countries are losing billions of dollars through tax abuse, money laundering and grand corruption. Investigative journalism is key to paving the way for change. It raises awareness amongst citizens and creates a momentum where governments are pressured to act by civil society. Such work has tremendous impact whether it is focusing awareness on illicit finance, helping to recover stolen assets or informing policy. We have already seen this with the Panama papers. However, many stories focus on Europe and the Americas. Money Trail delivers high quality training in financial investigations, digital security and campaign tactics from leading practitioners to more than 200 journalists and civil society activists in Asia, Africa and Europe. Journalismfund.eu provides around 80 grantsto independent financial investigations. Many newly emerging stories about tax abuseand grand corruption will generate citizen awareness and disbelieve. Activists are trained and supported to leverage these stories, using them in their campaign narratives and tactics with a view to change abusive policies and practices. Financial transactions between people and countries have become increasingly complex. Therefore, we need to understand and constantly check realities. We are committed to unravel money trails and tell the truth. Money Trail is supported by the National Postcode Lottery(NPL) of the Netherlands.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
